website_summaries.verdict: A well-balanced gluten-free dog food with added ingredients to improve the health of your pet. A close contender for the best.
pros: Features nutrient-dense ingredients, including broccoli, spinach, and kale
Includes glucosamine and chondroitin to help bone and joint health
Flaxseed and salmon oils contain omega-3 fatty acids to improve skin and coat
cons: Pricey even when compared to other gluten-free options

website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a grain-free dog food with the highest quality, this is a good choice – nothing artificial in a formula that meets your dog's nutritional needs.
pros: A top brand in grain-free dog food thanks to its wholesome ingredients that include quality protein,  antioxidants, omega acids, vegetables, and probiotics
cons: It's expensive, but it offers superb ingredients and nutrition for the price

customer_reviews.title: Did something change in this dog food?? Normally a 5 star rating but last couple of times, very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Did something change in this dog food? I’ve been buying this same brand of dog food for 6+ years. The last couple of bags I’ve ordered from Amazon my dog has turned his nose up to, and these same bags have been missing the bag closure seam (to keep the dog food fresh). In reading some top the recent reviews, it seems there might be some quality assurance issuers with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: its a shame im gonna have to waste all this food but im pretty sure it will ...
customer_reviews.text: i being ordering this dog food for my dog for almost a year and i normally get the big bag but i ordered the 12 oz this time around and found some nasty worms on it.... its a shame im gonna have to waste all this food but im pretty sure it will be better than getting my dog sick.... the worms still alive and moving
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand of food three times so far. The last bag, which I opened earlier this week, gave my dog diarrhea. He is otherwise extremely healthy and has no food sensitivities, so quality control must off over at Wellness. I'm getting in touch with them shortly, and I anticipate a full refund. I would advise you to stay away from this food.
customer_reviews.author: Grobbles

customer_reviews.title: Bag locking technology suddenly diminished
customer_reviews.text: I've used Wellness brand for many many years now for both my cats and dogs and I love it. I am lowering the rating by two stars because the newest bag came with a new ziplocking technology that is inferior to the one they've used for years. This will force me to buy a container which I didn't want to do. I like storing the food in these original bags that are lined with foil. I think it protects the quality far better than bins. Thanks for hearing me out.
customer_reviews.author: jaredneale

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: While not settled science, this is grain free food with peas and potato filler and has raised concerns about cardiomegaly - enlarged hearts - in canines. My beautiful German Shepherd died suddenly of this condition. Fed her this food for years. No proof of a direct connection to this food but research has shown me that there is zero science proving a grain free diet is good for any dog long term. I'm returning to a balanced diet for my dogs in future.
customer_reviews.author: RGIV

customer_reviews.title: Big difference in quality
customer_reviews.text: I feed my dogs quality stuff. Before this, I was feeding them Taste of the Wild and similar foods for their whole lives. I've only gone through two bags of this so far, and their coat has reduced shedding and feels soft and fuller than ever before. While this bag is more expensive for a slightly smaller weight than the typical 30 pound bag, it's worth it. My dogs also aren't getting board with this food either!
customer_reviews.author: Ravenhurst

customer_reviews.title: Caused $1,000+ Vet Bill
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was in perfect health until this bag came. We’ve used the small breed for a year and thought to give this a try. She has had massive diarrhea, losing so much blood from her stool that she required hospitalization. Vet thought just a GI infection- reintroduced this food- same thing. Buyer beware. That’s a lot of pain for our baby, money for a vet bill for a very expensive bag of dog food that I now get to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: P. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have been on wellness since weined to dog food. Not sure if this was a bad batch or not, but dogs got extremely sick and had to be taken to vet only to find out it was the food they were eating.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Make better bags!
customer_reviews.text: My dog refuses to eat this food when it’s in a large bag, she will eat it for about a week then turn up her nose at it. I do store it in an airtight container. I had to switch to buying small bags. Out of all the flavors she tired of this one first, but still loves the wild game bag and the lamb bag. It all depends on the dog though. I just wish they had consistent freshness with bag sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Fi

customer_reviews.title: Made my pup sick
customer_reviews.text: Bag arrived in perfect shape fed my pup for a day then the next she had diarrhea then the day after she had diarrhea and was throwing up...I’ll still feed her the name brand just not from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Young_gun303

customer_reviews.title: Warning!!
customer_reviews.text: The day after we started feeding this food to our 9 year old black lab mix, she vomited all the food up, had trouble walking/standing and then collapsed and started seizing. She was also peeing uncontrollably. We were very alarmed because this has never happened before. Thankfully she recovered. We immediately threw out all the food and went back to Taste of the Wild, which she's eaten without problems for years. We will never buy this brand of dog food again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: the best, don't give in to cheap food!
customer_reviews.text: i thought i could save some $$ by switching to a less schmancy brand for my 2 small dogs - NOPE. I had gotten some Rachel Ray food for them because it was ridiculously on sale @ my grocery store and I'm between contracts right now... Both have gotten random skin issues that they've never had before. Put them back on the grain free and their skin & coats are so much silkier and healthier and they LOVE the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Neva

customer_reviews.title: Moldy Food Open and In Box
customer_reviews.text: Everything is usually great with the food, but when the package arrived half of the food was out in the shipping box and was moldy and wet. Really not happy with this expensive food being carelessly delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Jenson Titus Lavallee

customer_reviews.title: My lesson learned: Do your research before finding a good dog food brand
customer_reviews.text: Switched from feeding my dog pig snouts and goat hooves (okay, corn, bone meal, gluten and animal fat are really the first ingredients) in the "Yellow bag" to feeding her deboned turkey, turkey and chicken meal, peas, potatoes, and chicken liver in Wellness' bag. I didn't really want a grain-free food for her, so I supplement with the non-grain free canned food and mix it together. I don't really know if she truly likes it better, but she does anticipate meal times with more interest and vigor, and if 7 pm comes around and dinner hasn't been served, she stares me down with a wagging tail til it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Y.

customer_reviews.title: Reportedly causes heart disease! 😢
customer_reviews.text: I am devastated to learn that this product is linked to causing heart disease in dogs. I did verify it online My dog loves the product and I bought it because it had great reviews and I thought it was one of the best dog foods. Now I can’t even return what I just bought because I’m outside the return window. 😢
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Miller

customer_reviews.title: solid bowel movements each day - one in the morning and one in the evening (giving you a lot of personal info here) - and she seems to really like the taste and texture
customer_reviews.text: I had read that this was one of the healthiest dog food options so we switched over to it. We had previously been using Rache Ray’s Nutrish wet dog food but it was giving our dog the runs and a lot of gas. This dry Core food has changed that. She now has two regular, solid bowel movements each day - one in the morning and one in the evening (giving you a lot of personal info here) - and she seems to really like the taste and texture! She’s a 12lbs yorkiepoo. We’re really happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: newyorkcity

customer_reviews.title: Healthy dog food for healthy pupper
customer_reviews.text: I researched dog foods for a while before coming across this one. It is a reasonable price compared to some of the other brands of dog food in this range. We made the switch from Blue Buffalo to this and haven't looked back since. Yes it is a little bit more money but this is definitely a quality dog food. Our dog's coat shines like no other and he looks especially healthy on this diet. He never has irregular bowel movements. This gives him all the energy he needs and he hasn't gained any excess weight while on this. I highly recommend giving this dog brand a try - you might never look back ;)
customer_reviews.author: Geodome

customer_reviews.title: NEW: 24 pound bag for the price of a 26 pound bag:  untruth in advertising?
customer_reviews.text: Product is great; however, it is appalling to buy and pay for a 26-pound bag and receive a 24-pound bag (no price adjustment offered). Now, to be sure, this doesn't fall into the category of: (1) getting poison ivy or (2) having someone wash your whites together with a brand new red sweatshirt. The world will continue to rotate on its axis. That said, just be truthful. If you want to raise the price of your dog food, just raise it (yes, quality costs more). People can make an informed choice on behalf of Fido. Harrumph.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jetson

customer_reviews.title: Major digestive issues
customer_reviews.text: Switched out 1.5 year old aussiedoodle to this food after seeing its great ratings, but she has had serious digestive issues since the switch. Vomiting, diarrhea and just generally acting like she feels bad. We will be switching back to Avoderm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food I wish it was a little less expensive but you do get what you pay for. I tried to switch to amazons brand wag and she will only eat it if I put some tasty soft morsels with it. This product she eats and asks for more And it gives her energy and a nice coat and she goes regularly etc... Great product 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What dog foods are truly good for our dogs/pets???
customer_reviews.text: My mini golden doodle has done wonderfully on this food and she is 4 years old. She has NEVER had diarrhea, vomiting or any type of distress. She is healthy and never lethargic, and has never had problems with skin or ears or anything!! Having said that, I am disgusted because It seems that no long term, intense research has been done by Vet colleges to protect our dogs. I as a dog owner want to do the best for my let and I feel like being held hostage!! Ok, end of rant!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zildjian20

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS USE CORE!!
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love this kibble. Have used for years with no problems. Great nutrient values.
customer_reviews.author: maitai

customer_reviews.title: Dog food my boys love.
customer_reviews.text: We are a little picky when it comes to dog food. We have to be, one of our boys has a very sensitive stomach and throws up if he eats inferior ingredients. We were on a different dog food for years until he started throwing up. Upon research, I found that the manufacturers had changed the ingredients but kept the price. After a lot of searching and reading labels, we found Wellness CORE. My two boys love the Wellness CORE brand. And I have a lot of faith in the company and the ingredients they use. Our neighborhood Poop scooper says our boys have the best Poop in the neighborhood. Lastly, use the subscription option! It has changed our lives!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this brand for some time.Although I am not a fan of processed kibble,this particular brand has no meat by products,and no preservatives.I fed my first girl this food later in her life.She loved it.I have started my 3yr.old Belgian Malinois on this.The foster were feeding her Purina so she now has stomach issues.Slowly,the gas and putrid smell have decreased.No more waking up at 2am gagging.I would recommend this brand over Blue and Science Diet.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old German Shepherd was having not-so-firm stools ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old German Shepherd was having not-so-firm stools and I was under the impression a grain free dog food may help. This dog food was not the solution. I constantly had to add extras to the dog food to get her to eat. Other than that, no issues with the quality or packaging. Always on time, nothing spoiled and seemed very fresh. I am currently transitioning her from Wellness Core to Royal Canin to see if her stools firm up.
customer_reviews.author: CherylB

customer_reviews.title: Food for my dog
customer_reviews.text: The dog eats it. Reluctantly sometimes but I don't know if that's the food or just him looking at me with those big brown eyes trying to get something better while also telegraphing, "don't you dare try to trick me with some lettuce or some sh!t." If I can hold out long enough he eventually turns to the bowl and licks it clean. So in conclusion: the food presumably tastes alright, smells not great (by human standards), and it's fascinating to think that dogs eat with the top of their tongue and drink with the underside of it. They're so talented!
customer_reviews.author: HelpfullyHopeful

customer_reviews.title: She loves this food.
customer_reviews.text: Our girl has Lyme diseases and was failing and Has lost so much weight on other brands of food (name brand foods). A friend recommended Core so we gave it a try. She loved the flavor and eats it quite well. She has been on it for two years and as you can see she is doing great. We still make sure she gets plenty of veggies and fruit as I know they are important also.
customer_reviews.author: pinky2

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking for an alternate food for my Shiba Inu from Blue Buffalo Wilderness, & I have to say I am thoroughly pleased with this brand & have now chosen to subscribe through Amazon. She is able to hold the food down and haven't experienced any vomiting of whole food particles because she just couldn't digest Wilderness for some reason. I see a difference in her coat & she is fattening up nicely. She was becoming so thin before. Great product always fast delivery Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Rogue317

customer_reviews.title: My picky eaters love it
customer_reviews.text: Have two picky eaters. Since changing to this food (based on a review of the ingredients comparing 15 brands) over 3 yrs ago have never had to look for another brand. Dogs love it, if at some point need to feed them something else for a day or two they are always happy when i give them back this one! Always arrived fresh, never a torn bag like i often found at the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Camilala

customer_reviews.title: Heart Disease Cause - STEER CLEAR
customer_reviews.text: Vet informed us that the FDA believes a Grain Free diet is causing heart disease. Specifically told us to switch our 70lb lab off this good. Switched to Purina zone. Google FDA grain free diet dog and you’ll see what I’m talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: MY 2 dogs refuse to eat this food.  I have tried daily but they spit it out on the floor.
customer_reviews.text: I was out of town for the Thanksgiving Holiday and missed the return deadline. I am so skeptical of Amazon reviews that I hesitate to trust them when it comes to my dogs. I know immediately for myself, but I have to rely on my dogs response and they generally are positive and happy. It was a Definite No Go for this food! Sorry I will forgo my refund and donate the food to a shelter which will appreciate the donation. It is best to shop at our local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky eater!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6yr old rescue who’s a picky eater. He came to me skipping a meal at least once a week and addicted to canned food. I had him on Taste of the Wild and he liked it, and had him weaned down to a spoon of canned food but wanted to get him off the canned stuff. He wouldn’t eat without it though. I started reading reviews and figured that it was worth a shot to switch him to Core. It’s been amazing! I graduated him over and he demolishes every meal!! No canned food and he hasn’t skipped any meals. No digestive issues either.
customer_reviews.author: Jpp

customer_reviews.title: Quality brand, good value, but made my dog gassy
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research I chose to switch my dog to Wellness grain-free. He was eating Blue Buffalo but the cost was becoming prohibitive and I like the convenience of the food being delivered to my door. This seems to be a good, reliable brand, but only four stars since this food seemed to give my dog more gas than before. I waited a few months to make sure it wasn't just stomach upset from switching the food, even though I switched slowly per vet recommendations, and the problem persisted. I will probably switch to a different brand just to see if it suits him better.
customer_reviews.author: Tawny9753

customer_reviews.title: Good Food for Sensitive Pups!
customer_reviews.text: My rescue dog is a picky eater with a sensitive stomach which made finding food that she liked that also kept her from stinking and having her stomach grumble was very difficult. I tried a lot of different brands at various cost points until I decided to give this a try. I liked that it was grain free and also had probiotics in it and it has been a great change. Not only does she actually seem to enjoy eating all her food now but the gas and stomach noises are now at a minimum. I love that its healthy food that my dog loves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend this Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs eat this food. Riley (unknown ethnicity, sort of a lab/bassett/who knows mix, about 45 pounds) had an issue with throwing up his food. So I researched and found that often grains in the dog food can be a problem. I then researched grain-free foods and Wellness had a good reputation. Riley loves it and eats it without throwing up. Problem solved. I transitioned my other dog Lexie (hound mix, about 50 pounds) to the same food, and she loves it too. I do the automatic ordering and buy it through Amazon and have it delivered just about monthly to the front door.
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: High quality, healthy, and tasty
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs have eaten this food for their entire lives (4 years). Their fur is very shiny and they have a lot of energy and seem very healthy. It has more protein than a lot of other premium brands and my dogs like the taste. I have never had an issue with the quality of this food after 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kibble
customer_reviews.text: This grain free kibble is all my dogs eat and after 7 years of feeding it, they still love it. It’s good for them, they maintain a healthy weight (I’m a believer in self feeding, rather than timed meals), and it’s a well balanced diet. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LKB

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves!
customer_reviews.text: Wellness Core Natural Grain Free Dry Dog Food is a quality dog food that my lab loves. Unfortunately, the box it arrived in was almost in pieces. Thankfully the bag of dog food was intact. Five stars for the dog food. One star for Amazon’s packaging.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Customer for past 2.5 Years
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my pit bull CORE Wellness dog food for the past 2.5 years (ever since he was a pup) and he loves it! (I switched him to The Taste of the Wild for a couple months, but I noticed he was loosing too much weight on it, so I switched back to CORE) It keeps him lean, healthy, and properly nourished. It keeps his coat soft and shinny and he never has bad breath. His poop is also healthy and consistent. I take him to the vet regularly, and my vet always says he's very healthy. It is more expensive than most, but you get what you pay for. Pay the extra money, its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Augustin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality brand
customer_reviews.text: I have a one year old English Bulldog (45lbs), who is NOT a picky eater, but does have reactions to other brands. His coat is extremely soft after being on CORE, and his hot spots have completely gone away since transitioning. I buy a 12lb bag, and it lasts him a full month. He is a very active dog for a bulldog, and I noticed him getting skinnier on other brands (Rachael Ray, Blue Buffalo, Costco Kirkland Brand for Puppies) since feeding him core, he is maintaining a healthy weight, and his coat is SO shiny. I add a few drops of cod derived hemp oil and it's perfect for him! Great brand, somewhat more expensive but definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Batch?
customer_reviews.text: My dog normally loves this food, but this last bag that we got has made her very sick. She vomits each time. When it first happened to gave her plain chicken to see if she would keep it down, and she did. Then I gave her a tiny handful of her food, and she didn't keep it down. This food is the only food that doesn't make her itchy, because she has some allergies, so I don't want to switch the brand or type of food I'm giving her. I'm not sure how to tell if a bag if good or bad either unless it s too late.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my sensitive dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food, they cant eat beef and this is a great alternative to beef. I was feeding them the soft version of this food, but once I added this hard food into their diet, they eat less canned. I can hear crunch crunch crunch coming from the kitchen and I just know they like it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Stifflear

customer_reviews.title: but the boxes were in good shape. So who knows how long this food ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to switch my dogs to Welness Core. Both 26lb bags came with holes in the seal, but the boxes were in good shape. So who knows how long this food has been sitting in a warehouse absorbing moisture.
customer_reviews.author: B.T.

customer_reviews.title: It smells so bad.
customer_reviews.text: We always buy this for my dog and she loves it. But this particular delivery smells so bad. My dog doesn't want to eat it. Unfortunately, I cannot return it because my daughter was the one who opened it then transfered it to my dog's food container and threw away the original packing bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie Greene

customer_reviews.title: My dogs have enjoyed this food for several years
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have enjoyed this food for several years. They have good energy, and don't have any digestive issues with it. I appreciate that Amazon carries this brand. The bags are generally decently packaged. A few times, there was a small hole or two, leaking food. Probably got tossed around a bit by the shipper, due to the weight. A bit of packaging tape seals the holes without a problem, and the dogs enjoy it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food but the price is a little high
customer_reviews.text: Switched my dog off of pedigree and looked at reviews for some of the best rated dog food. While looking I came across this one and decided to give it a try. AND HE LOVED IT. Before he would eat slow and not be excited to eat, but once he tried this he literally drools while waiting for me to put food in his bowl. The only downside to this product is the price. It's pretty steep compared other brands, but your dog will thank you for the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Something's Not Right
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs enjoyed the first few bags of this food. However, recently our 7-year old, very active lab isn't that interested in eating it, and he's been a bit constipated. He'll eat it, but I have to encourage him, which is really odd. He looks great and acts great otherwise, but I'm going to switch to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: So far, the best for our lab pup
customer_reviews.text: Its a tad bit more than I wanted to spend on dog food but our 6 month old black lab puppy looks and feels amazing when on Wellness. We used the puppy formula until his adult teeth came in and now he is on the regular variety. We have also used Rachael Ray's grain free food and its okay and we tried the Costco grain free kind because it had pretty good reviews on DogFoodAdvisor but our puppy lost his shiny coat within a week of a food change. He is almost iridescent when on the Wellness and like others have said it takes a little less to feed since its such a concentrated food.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Three, NC

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has a good price, which makes it affordable
customer_reviews.text: We fed our pugs Wellness Core Grain Free--off and on--for years, always aware it was top quality because our relative manages a pet supply store. At one point it became too expensive for our budget, so we switched brands. Then one dog developed allergies, which we thought were related to pollen and grass. We felt so sorry for him and didn't want to put him on shots or steroids. On a hunch we decided to go back to feeding Wellness Core. He completely stopped scratching within a few days! Amazon has a good price, which makes it affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Lee

customer_reviews.title: Poultry didn't work for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have two dogs, a 50lb Anatolian Shepherd/Bull dog mix, and a 110lb Rottweiler/Black Lab. The Rottador always had a bit of a stomach issue on this food, but it wasn't until we adopted the bully that we realized the food wasn't going to work in our situation. Our bully started having very itchy skin and his hair was falling out in droves. We've since switched to Fromm all red meat formula and both the stomach issues and itchy/hairloss issues have resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Shane G.

customer_reviews.title: My boy loves this food!!
customer_reviews.text: My 85 # American Staffordshire loves it ! Before it was hard to get him to eat and finish. But now he actually gets excited when its dinner time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Once I discovered this food I have never gone back to anything else. I've had dogs for 35 years and even home-cooked their meals for a while. I've had one universal problem.. they were all over weight to one degree or another, no matter how much I reduced their portions. It never ocurred to me that the fat content wasn't the culprit. By accident I discovered that grain free essentially means carb-free, and I guess by now we all know the effect a carb-free diet has. YAY. I finally have completely satiated pets that are trim and energetic! My finicky eater is the first one to her bowl now, too. Quite the testimonial to how this food tastes to pets..
customer_reviews.author: GardenGirl

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the resealable bags
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been purchasing the 26 lbs bag for a few years now, they have always come in the resealable freshness bag. The material the bag comes in makes it hard to close it without the resealable snap.. Please please go back to original resealable bag, if the next time I order and it’s the same I think we may hasten ave to try different brand Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Michel

customer_reviews.title: We did feel it gave the nutrition it should have.
customer_reviews.text: This food was not good for our dog. Didn't give the nutrition. Our dog was constantly hungry, her pooping frequency & amount increased. Switched to another brand, she is back to her regular habits.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Chantelau

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this food.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a dog food that would satisfy our Labrador and mix Collie. And also one that produces a healthy stool. This one does it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Victor G

customer_reviews.title: Dog refused to eat
customer_reviews.text: My Wheaton Terrier would not eat this dog food. I finally had to go back to Taste of the Wild and then tried mixing the Core with the new. He was too smart and pick out the Core and eat only the Taste of the Wild. I tried this food as we had switched our cat food to this Wellness brand which initially he appeared to like but that taste too changed and we went back to Blue for our cat.
customer_reviews.author: dmmcdon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommed!
customer_reviews.text: We have two resident dogs as well as a revolving door for foster dogs. This is the food we serve to everyone. One of our resident dogs requires a grain free diet and we never know if the fosters will be grain sensitive or not - it can't hurt to give them the grain free food. They transition from whatever food they've been on (usually junk) to this very easily and every one of them has loved it. We also have had no issues getting the underweight dogs to gain weight with this food. So far we haven't had any overweight fosters, but our residents are both at very healthy weights with 2x per day feedings. Highly recommend Wellness Core.
customer_reviews.author: Disneyfan 66

customer_reviews.title: Helping with hair growth, they are peppy and always want more food!
customer_reviews.text: I switched my 3 dogs to this food from canidae grain free, which they loved, but I wanted to try something new and I needed a grain free diet food for one of them. I like to have brand continuity so if they eat each other's food their stomachs will handle it better. They love this one, gobble it all up every time and go sniffing for more. Their coats are shiny and the areas where they had hair loss are starting to grow back. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Guyer

customer_reviews.title: The best food for my dog
customer_reviews.text: The best food for my dog! My neighbor's dog comes over begging for it because they feed her cheap wheat-filled GMO garbage. She devours it. Our dog is approaching ten and has never once had any health problems on this diet. It's such good food!
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My dogs like it, and no more tummy troubles!
customer_reviews.text: My four large dogs seem to like the Wellness Core dog food. Two of my dogs had digestive problems (runny stool, excessive gas, etc.) on other brands of dog food, but have done very well with the grain free Wellness Core. I would recommend it to anyone whose dogs have digestive issues. It can't hurt to try it, right? The only issue I have is now that I am a subscribe and save customer, the price per bag seems to be going up a little more each month. I don't blame Amazon, because they have the best price overall, especially with the free delivery service, but I do wish the price would stay the same every time. :)
customer_reviews.author: Hammy

customer_reviews.title: My three dogs like this food
customer_reviews.text: For the first time, a dog food all three of my dogs like. No allergies or upset tummies.
customer_reviews.author: BethLove

customer_reviews.title: Healthy
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this food regularly for my diabetic 10 year old chihuahua. There is definitely pepp in his step after the switch! 😍
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Ann

customer_reviews.title: expensive...so of course my dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: So far my Akita is loving this food. I've tried taste of the wild I've tried crave I've tried Purina but he was picky. So far he is loving this food and eats all of his food where before he could careless and would eat only a few bites.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Quality grain free dog food
customer_reviews.text: This dog food worked wonders for my large dog. I went through several different name brand dog foods before stumbling upon this one. In my opinion this is a good quality dog food. My dog has a sensitive stomach and is indeed allergic to grain. These kibbles keep her full—but then again she’s a dog and loves her some treats!
customer_reviews.author: Rini

customer_reviews.title: Dog Diarrhea... Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I started to buy Wellness Core on Amazon because I know and love the brand but often found myself lacking the time to get new bags every month from the specialty place. Let me avoid any mistakes by saying: I LOVE WELLNESS CORE – it is great, high-quality dog food. That being said, I now ONLY buy from the local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Sypher

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not consistant
customer_reviews.text: We have bought this for our corgi for several months now with no issues and his coat looked fabulous but this time we ordered his food he has been having dirrhea for several days now because of the food. Nothing else has changed so it may be the food, so we are having to switch to a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the flavor but check the contents
customer_reviews.text: We've been feeding this to our dogs for about 5 years. The dogs love it when a new bag arrives. However the last bag we received had stuff that resembles sawdust chips. I will try one more bag and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: crpowell

customer_reviews.title: Quit buying it after using it for a while
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food, I used to order it through Amazon for a while, but I had to quit due to doctor advice after my dog start vomiting. Doctor said that grain free is not recommended for my dog type (goldendoodle)
customer_reviews.author: Maysaa

customer_reviews.title: This food saved my puppy's health
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are both doing great with this food and love it! I started feeding Wellness Core when my 1-1/2 yr old pointer mix couldn't properly digest other popular grain free brands, refused to eat. Each time urinalysis showed issues and she quickly got to the point of needing prescription food! It's crazy that such a young, active, happy and otherwise healthy dog should be having life threatening issues from her food! We gave one last try with non-prescription foods ... no more issues or vet visits and both of my dogs love the food !!! We have this on regular delivery so the price is excellent. We love and recommend this food for all dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn F

customer_reviews.title: Core
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active dog, we walk 4 times a day and she bikes with me daily. With all the activity I decided to go with CORE, she needs a high protein diet due to her activity levels. I am a firm believer in what I feed her today will help determine her health as a senior dog. I had not thought about buying dog food through Amazon, I saved $12.00 a bag and with Prime no shipping. Delivered right to my door, no carrying in through the store loading in the car, and hauling it into the house. The UPS man stated almost every 5 deliveries he makes are dog food and groceries these days.
customer_reviews.author: Chon

customer_reviews.title: I was shocked to learn that pretty much every single dog food sold in your standard ...
customer_reviews.text: There is a dog food review website...which has almost every dog food made listed...giving them 1 to 6 stars, and giving a full analysis of every dog food and the benefits and possible harmful effects. I was shocked to learn that pretty much every single dog food sold in your standard grocery store falls in the 1 star category...even the brands you though were really healthy, according to their commericals on tv. I switched to Wellness CORE Natural Grain Free Dry Dog Food...which is rated at 6 stars. My dog loves the taste, and is VERY healthy. And, it's made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Kinectamaniac

customer_reviews.title: I'm reviewing for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: This food was recommended by my vet, and my dog loves it and devours it. I guess that would be considered "Two Thumbs (Paws?) Up." Dog is very healthy and energetic and happy.
customer_reviews.author: EricJM

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go to food for my labs for 6 or 7 yrs. The only problem I had with this purchase was the bag was without reseal zip lock strip. Not good when you have no place to store open bag.
customer_reviews.author: T. Secrrest

customer_reviews.title: I have 4 small dogs. This food is gobbled ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 small dogs. This food is gobbled up by each of them and I presoak it in a bit of water to soften it - as two of my dogs are genetically predisposed to tooth loss and have few teeth. I find that the price is worth it in terms of feeding quantity ( high nutrition - smaller portions required ) and their little "tootsie rolls" are firm and not runny. I will NOT buy any other food for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kit St. Claire

customer_reviews.title: This is the only dry food our Zoe has consistently eaten and does not make her sick
customer_reviews.text: This food was recommended by our vet and we have now had our beagle on it for two years now. It is the only dry food that Zoe will consistently eat and the amount of protein in it keeps her vibrant and healthy. Plus it does not have all those nasty elements and dyes like most other dog foods. Being grain free is very important for dogs, especially given their predisposition to grain allergies (something which Zoe has unfortunately developed worse over the years of eating cheap, grain-filled dyed food). Keep your pup happy and healthy with Wellness and they'll thank you with many a wag of the tail. :-)
customer_reviews.author: A Couple of Als (Mr. & Mrs. Al Gordon)

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Yummy...!
customer_reviews.text: All my little paws love this dog food!! I have never had a problem with my delivery or packaging always on time and fresh! Thanks Amazon for the extra savings being on a monthly subscription is a nice perk!
customer_reviews.author: LV FAM

customer_reviews.title: Give Your Dogs The Coat of A Baby Seal (No Harm To Baby Seals)!
customer_reviews.text: Makes my dogs' hair the talk of the town! The vet tech said that my Frank had the coat of baby Seal! It doesn't get much better than that, folks! I switched them off of it for a while last year to save money and for every penny I saved, I spent a dollar's worth of additional cleaning time vacuuming up dead, dry, shedding hair. They still shed on Wellness Core, but not nearly as much as when I put them on inferior/cheaper food.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah944

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for 7 years
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been on thie dog food for 7 years. He had major stomach and skin issues prior to switching him to this food. I feel this is a quality grain free dog food and I recommend it to anyone who has issues with their dog's health. What you put into your dog you are going to get out. If you feed your dog crappy food that is sold in a supermarket than expect health issues to arise. It would be the same if you ate crap fast food every day. Your health would deteriorate quickly until you made a major diet change
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Healthy pup!  Tasty enough to use as training treats too!
customer_reviews.text: Puppy loves this, and I feel good about the company. Had inconsistency problems with Nutro (pup REFUSED to eat one particular bag of the same type of food he'd always eaten), and similar problems with Blue Buffalo (and pup got very sick around the time he was eating Blue, may or may not have been related, but we changed the food once we got him healthy just in case!) Pup is shiny, happy, healthy, and gobbles this stuff down. He likes it so much we use individual kibble pieces as reward treats for training! Win!
customer_reviews.author: MissGrover3

customer_reviews.title: First quality dog food at best price I've ever found
customer_reviews.text: The best dog food I have ever found for my dogs. No grains, no filler vegetables, a truly protein-based food. I converted to it years ago from doing my own pretty rigorous raw food based diet for dogs. I have never had a dog raised on this Core and/or raw diet die of cancer; all my dogs (rescues) raised on cheap kibble and the street have died of cancer after years shorter lives. I've only had six dogs in my life and many factors can affect this, but still.... Plus with Subscribe and Save Amazon makes it affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Cuevas (aka Judith Ivory)

customer_reviews.title: Best dry dog food available on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best dry dog food available on the market..better than blue..my dog has a sensitive stomach and never once has been sick anymore with this dog food and never has had diarrhea being on it. This food with a little hamburger and rice occasionally seems to make for a healthy dog. I've tried all the best brands but this tops them all in my opinion. My dog's coat is always super shiny and she never itches either. Food is delivered super quickly too. And it's almost ten bucks cheaper if you get amazon s free shipping option than if I go to the pet stores to buy it!
customer_reviews.author: luckydog

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: Although my dog liked the food she gained a lot of weight on it eating the same quantity as her last food. Also her vet flipped when we said she was eating this grain free brand - something about the grain free and its link to heart problems. Took her off immediately.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: we have been happy with this dog food
customer_reviews.text: So far, we have been happy with this dog food. Our dogs seem to like the flavor and, coupled with fish oil and glucosamine, they have gotten a bit of spring back in their step. The latest package that arrived was split open just a bit, so I decided to go ahead and use it. Now my oldest dog (11) will not move very much and my younger dog seems to be "down" more often. I'm not sure why Amazon would just go ahead and toss an opened bag in a box and send it out (the box was not damaged), but now I can't use the food. $60.00 in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: TLB

customer_reviews.title: Dog is allergic to food- loss of fur
customer_reviews.text: I purchases this for my dog and his hair began to fall out in clumps in his hind quarters. This has never ever happened in 10 years. He has eaten Beneful and I am trying to change him to something a lot healthier. Unfortunately it will not be Wellness Core
customer_reviews.author: DEEYOUSEE

customer_reviews.title: Great for Allergic dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog with skin allergies and after a year of trying everything finally figured out that he needs a high protein low carb diet. I was cooking his food for a while but the smell of the liver cooking was too much for me, so I started looking for a dry food that was low carb high protein. He eats it - he isn't in love with it, but who would be after having home cooked meals for months! I still give him home cooked meat and cooked green veggies for breakfast, and the dry food for dinner. His fur has grown back and although he still gets itchy sometimes, his condition has improved 95%.
customer_reviews.author: S. Levanduski

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and great choice for healthy dog food option
customer_reviews.text: Love this food for my English bulldog. Bulldogs are known for skin irritations and losing their hair...if not cared for properly. This food is great, I have a healthy 2 year old dog who loves this food mixed nu pro, a joint and hip supplement. She does well and her coat does not feel oily or stinky. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Zaida

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs have been eating CORE for ten years without a single problem
customer_reviews.text: We've been feeding our two miniature dachshunds this dog food for nearly ten years and have never experienced any digestive or gastric problems. I would highly recommend you get your dog on this food as soon as possible; you will be glad you did. The dogs are still quite active for their age and their coats are healthy. We couldn't be happier with the results of the CORE dog food.
customer_reviews.author: KTrout

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Blue. Then I read reviews on this. Ordered it. Dogs love it. Poops aren't as big as with the Blue. Nuf said. Seriously though: yes, it's expensive, but you should know by now that you pay for quality. Get it. Snoopy will love it.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Quality, human grade, not a Diamond food (super ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality, human grade, not a Diamond food (super important!) - and my German shepherd loves it. Her coat is soooo soft on this food! Poops are firm. But, as with any food, must transition slowly. Wellness is so rich that it took about 10 days to transition for her, to avoid soft poops. Higher kcal/cup than Kirkland Nature's Domain GF Turkey, so even though more expensive, it's not as much as you think, since you feed a bit less. No more itchy, dry skin! Wow. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: LRC5555

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Food For Your Pets--the best out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite dog food. I normally make homemade dog food for my Sheltie but it's becoming labor intensive and so I bought this at Petco. Lily wolfed it down and it is gentle on her stomach (and she has a very sensitive tummy-will throw up at the drop of a hat, hence the homemade dog food). I now order it off Amazon because it is cheaper than Petco and I don't have to lug it around or make a special trip. I've even put my Mom's Buddy on it as well as the Core cat food for her kittens. We are huge Core fans!
customer_reviews.author: Rebdeb

customer_reviews.title: The end result was not good
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the dog food did not agree with my dogs ( cocker spaniels). They love the flavor ate it up quickly but within a week there bowel movements were runny and very nasty looking. So I will not be getting this product again unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Andree Crittenden

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved.
customer_reviews.text: According to our dog he said it’s the best he has had so far LOL. We have gone there several variations of food and found that this worked the best for him. No allergic reactions to it.
customer_reviews.author: John Migliaro

customer_reviews.title: Helped Us A Lot
customer_reviews.text: I switched my 1.5 year-old Shiba Inu puppy to this food recently. Previously he was eating Royal Canin, which I suspect was causing his recent bout of bad gas and loose stool. This new kibble has really improved his tummy troubles. One thing I did notice is that these kibble pieces are larger than he previously had, which took him awhile to get used to. If you have a dog that is medium-small, they might not like this particular formula. I was worried I might receive a damaged bag after reading previous reviews, but everything turned out fine, the bag was intact and new.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I have noticed since my dog started eating this is that he no longer has stinky breath. Which is amazing! I can tell he enjoys this food over others because i have boughten other brands and he seems to take longer to eat. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A.Mend

customer_reviews.title: Best food I have found for 2 active mutts
customer_reviews.text: This is about the best dry dog food you can get for the price. I have 2 40 pound, active dogs and they eat this about twice a day. This bag will last probably two weeks, but I also feed them some real chicken a few times per week. They have perfect stools but we do walk them every single day. This food has never upset they tummy and they continue to eat it. Read the ingredients and compare it to others, it has some good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Beau H.

customer_reviews.title: Vet says grain free dog food causes heart disease
customer_reviews.text: I thought grain free would be healthier, but my vet just told me that it causes heart disease. Ask your vet before you buy this!!
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: May not be the freshest...made my dogs sick.
customer_reviews.text: I normally feed this to my dog but there was something off about this bag. As soon as we started using it, all the dogs started having loose stools and a couple refused to eat. We threw it away and went to PetSmart for another bag and everything is returning to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Kohler Davis

customer_reviews.title: The dog eats it and she's very picky!
customer_reviews.text: I have a picky eater, very picky. My own fault, I've always cooked for her, made her treats, shared my food, created a food frankenstein essentially. She's well-mannered, she always takes the treat offered but then turns her head and spits it out on the floor. She eats this food and not only that but continues to eat this food. Lots of dry foods I've tried she'll eat for a week and then go without for 3 days rather than touch it again. I continue to mix her home-cooked meats and stews with it but she's actually eaten it just dry. Miraculous!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Chick

customer_reviews.title: High quality, affordable dog food.
customer_reviews.text: Balanced nutrition from high quality grain free ingredients at a reasonable price. My dog is very finicky and doesn't consistently eat anything, but even when she refuses to eat from her bowl at meal time we find that she will still eat the Wellness Core food from her treat dish.
customer_reviews.author: WEN in ATL

customer_reviews.title: Warning: do not purchase this defective product
customer_reviews.text: This dog food made our dogs extremely ill - bad diarrhea. They have never been this sick before. They won’t take fluids, and we likely have to bring them to the hospital as it’s been over 24 hrs. Do not buy this food. Maybe it’s an Amazon problem but we felt like we poisoned our dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Jmm

product_meta.title: Wellness CORE Natural Dry Dog Food Original Turkey & Chicken
product_meta.description: Style:Grain Free| Size:26 Pound BagWellness CORE Natural Grain Free Dry Dog Food Original Turkey & Chicken Recipe is healthy, 100% natural grain free dog food for adult dogs made with turkey, chicken, salmon oil and fruits and vegetables to help support your dog's optimal health and fortified with antioxidents, probiotics, vitamins and minerals, including fish and flax omega blend for healthy skin and coat. Wellness CORE grain free dog food formulas are based on the nutritional philosophy that dogs thrive on a diet mainly comprised of meat. Each grain free, nutrient-rich formula provides high quality protein for your dog with no meat by-products or fillers, grain, corn, soy, wheat-gluten or artificial preservatives, colors or flavors.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED NATURAL NUTRITION TO FUEL YOUR DOG'S BEST LIFE: Premium protein expertly balanced with nutrient rich superfoods for a complete and balanced dog food, with guaranteed levels of all the nutrients your dog needs to thrive and no fillers
SAVORY FOOD DOGS LOVE: Wellness CORE is available in grain and grain free recipes, as well as limited ingredient diets for dogs with food sensitivities
LEANER BODY MASS AND MUSCLE TONE: Wellness CORE dog food is made with a high concentration of protein from fresh meat ingredients
SUPPORTS HEALTHY SKIN AND COAT with guaranteed levels of omega fatty acids from ingredients such as flaxseed and salmon oil
WHOLE BODY HEALTH: Supported by omega fatty acids, antioxidants, glucosamine, probiotics and taurine for a healthy heart

Made in the USA using only the finest globally sourced ingredients, we prepare each of our diets in our own state of the art facility; we craft delicious natural recipes with wholesome, non GMO ingredients chosen for their nutritional benefits

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
